It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves, which are often thick and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. The plant has a short, woody stem with a single, upright growth habit. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale green, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
